clinical_study.brief_title: Somatic Disease Among Alcohol Abusers in an Out-day Patients' Clinic
clinical_study.official_title: Somatic Disease Among Alcohol Abusers in an Out-day Patients' Clinic. A Neglected Area

brief_summary.textblock:
Alcohol abuse is associated with a variety of clinical diseases, but studies on prevalence of different somatic diseases among alcohol abusers are lacking. Studies on populations in an out-day patients' clinic are also lacking.
The investigators aim to study somatic health standard in an out-day patients' clinic population of alcohol abusers, with regard to prevalence of different kinds of somatic diseases, and how the interaction of somatic and psychiatric treatment can influence on patients quality of life. Clinical examination including blood samples and echocardiographic examinations in all participants, other additional examinations (as x-ray, CT or MRI if indicated by clinical findings).

detailed_description.textblock: Retrospective methods will be used to study former somatic disease, cross-section design to study present somatic disease and prospective design to study quality of life, psychiatric and somatic health after combination of psychiatric and somatic examinations and treatment.

primary_outcome.measure: Prevalence of different kinds of somatic disease
primary_outcome.description: Prevalence of somatic disease at study attendance of any kind, specified for heart disease, gall- and liver disease, neuropathic disease.

secondary_outcome.description: Prevalence of former somatic disease investigated by anamnestic examination, search in patient journals and communication with the patients community health service.

secondary_outcome.measure: Outcome of psychiatric and somatic treatment of alcohol abusers
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life and score of somatic and psychiatric health 1 year after inclusion

arm_group.description: Alcohol abusers referred to out-day patients' clinic which consent to participate in the study
Control group for the cardiac arm of the study will be matched controls from the Nord-Tr√∏ndelag Health Study (HUNT)

intervention.intervention_name: Psychiatric and somatic examinations and ,if clinical indicated, treatment
intervention.description: Patients referred to the clinic will be given optimal treatment for revealed psychiatric and/or somatic disease including conversational therapy, and if indicated therapeutic interventions with respect to any kind of disease.

biospec_descr.textblock: Conventional blood samples including i.e. glycosylated haemoglobin, serum ferritin, serum gamma-GT, B-type natriuretic peptide.

study_pop.textblock: Alcohol abusers referred to the out-day patients' clinic at Dep. of Psychiatry, Levanger Hospital, Norway

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Alcohol abusers reffered to the out-day patients' clinic at Dep. of Psychiatry, Levanger Hospital, Norway
Exclusion Criteria:
- Not consenting to participate
- Not able to consent
